results.title: The Cameraman's Revenge
results.creator_credit: Khanzhonkov, Wladyslaw Starewicz and Aleksandr Khanzhonkov
results.brief_description: A jilted husband takes his revenge by filming his wife and her lover and showing the result at the local cinema. This was one of Starewicz’ first animated films, and stars a cast of animated beetles.

constellations_other.name: Storytime animated
constellations_other.description: Abra Cadabra was the world's first stereoscopic 3D film, but animators and filmmakers had experimented with the technology far earlier and continue to use other older techniques like stop-motion animation.

results.description: A jilted husband takes his revenge by filming his wife and her lover and showing the result at the local cinema. This was one of Starewicz’ first animated films, and stars a cast of animated beetles.

results.title: The Camera industry of Japan
results.brief_description: Japanese cameras are world famous and eagerly sought after in the western world today. This film visits the factories and shows the methods used in the construction of various types of cameras which are exported all over the world.
results.description: Japanese cameras are world famous and eagerly sought after in the western world today. This film visits the factories and shows the methods used in the construction of various types of cameras which are exported all over the world.

results.title: The Camera image: more than a record
results.creator_credit: David Hopwood and Northern Virginia Community College. Extended Learning Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Developing image”.
This program examines the pre-history of photography, discussing the concepts of visual perspective, mechanical devices leading to the invention of the camera, and the cultural needs that generated the invention of photography. The special qualities of the camera and its artistic capabilities are discussed.

results.title: The Camera and the tripod
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Video tech”.
This episode deals with what the camera sees - focus and shot sizes, how to make pictures look better and how to zoom, pan and tilt.

results.title: The Camera
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Photographic artist and educator Mark Johnstone uses a view camera to demonstrate and describe basic features common to all cameras. Illustrates the advantages and disadvantages of various types of cameras. Guest photographers explain how their particular cameras are ideal for their types of photography.

results.title: The Camel who took a walk (K)
results.brief_description: From the book written by Jack Tworkov, illustrated by Roger Duvoisin, this children’s film tells the story of a camel and what “did not” happen to him as he set out for his morning walk. Uses the pictures and text from the book. Suitable for pre-school level.

results.title: The Camel boy
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: In Australia’s early days the ship of the desert, the camel, was imported to help explore the harsh interior of this vast continent. Through the wonder of animation and live action ‘The Camel Boy’ takes you back to the beginning of this century for an exciting adventure story based on the actual journeys of explorers in Australia’s outback wilderness. The burning sands of the inland desert and the hurricane lashed waters of the ocean are the setting for this story of friendship between a boy and a camel.

results.title: The Calling
results.creator_credit: Jodie Passmore, Bridget Ikin, Felix Media and Angelica Mesiti
results.credit_line:
Angelica Mesiti

Ian Potter Moving Image Commission, ACMI Collection

Three channel video installation, digital video, sound, 35:26

Courtesy the artist and Anna Schwartz Gallery
results.material_description: three channel video, projection, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
‘The Calling’ is a three-channel video installation that focuses on whistling languages, ancient forms of non-verbal communication which are still used in 2013 to communicate in isolated and difficult landscapes.

To conduct research for ‘The Calling’, artist Angelica Mesiti travelled to the village of Kuskoy in Northern Turkey, the island of La Gomera in The Canary Islands and the Island of Evia in Greece where whistling languages are all still in use.

For these communities, whistling languages are in a process of transformation from their traditional use as tools for communication across vast lands into tourist attractions and cultural artefacts and are being taught to local school children.

‘The Calling’ is a poignant exploration of ancient human traditions evolving and adapting to the modern world. The work speaks to the tenacity and creativity of traditional cultures in the face of globalisation, technological progress and environmental flux.

This exhibition is the work of Sydney/Paris-based artist Angelica Mesiti, winner of the inaugural Ian Potter Moving Image Commission.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jodie Passmore, Bridget Ikin, Felix Media and Angelica Mesiti

results.title: The Calling
results.creator_credit: Lisa Chambers and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Madeline O’Connor is the perfect student and one destined to be a nun (according to her mother and the Sisters around her at school). Madeline has other ideas however and dreams of being a ballerina. She does everything in her power to misbehave and ward off any potential angels that might be tempted to come to her during the night - thus signalling she has been chosen by god. This is an uplifting comedy about ambition and fate.
